definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
delicate as a flower, refined as a precious jade (idiom)/(of a woman) exquisite
(of a woman) lovely as a flower (idiom)/beautiful

sentences.english: It is the terms of the earth that kept her smiles in bloom .
sentences.chinese: 大地的泪珠，使她的微笑如花一般灿烂不谢。

sentences.english: The original smile, then full of scars.
sentences.chinese: 原先笑靥如花，后来满是伤疤。

sentences.english: The sounds of falling snows of rivers are like a flower, blooming among thousands of hills.
sentences.chinese: 江雪落的声音，如花，开放的万壑千山。

sentences.english: Dimple like flower, lips gently in yours cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 笑靥如花，轻轻的吻在你的脸颊。

sentences.english: Shortage is still severe aimlessly flowery and good-looking youth.
sentences.chinese: 依旧漫无目的地荒度如花貌美的青春。

sentences.english: It is the tear of the earth that keep her smile in bloom.
sentences.chinese: 大地之上还摇曳着的清泪，更显出它现在的笑靥如花。

sentences.english: Just admiring a flower, such as flower arranging.
sentences.chinese: 比如欣赏一朵花，如花的布局。

sentences.english: Shou tomb, but could not restrain your flower face.
sentences.chinese: 守墓，却守不住你如花容颜。

sentences.english: You are facing the day you smile.
sentences.chinese: 你素面朝天你笑靥如花。

definition: tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
lit. countenance of a flower, face like the moon (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) beautiful
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
Dutchman's pipe cactus, aka Queen of the Night cactus (Epiphyllum oxypetalum)
pleasant/agreeable/a person after one's heart (charming person)/a gifted person
